comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Ha. Let's debunk the date. The shadows on this one are actually pretty good so I will hie me to the solar calculator to start with (though frankly, 45 degrees above the horizontal looks pretty much like July 6th to me).

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8468254@N02] Watching you anxiously! Don't want anyone to argue that this poster was printed on a recently patented weatherproof paper and may actually have been in situ for years...  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Actually about 60 degrees above the horizon, which makes it roughly eleven o'clock on the 6th of July.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Could be a week or so either side. I haven't put much care or attention into gauging the angles.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: This Google Streetview is under construction.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Just out of shot, on the gable of the building next door to the right, we see this: I wonder how old that ad is?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Power's Dining Rooms very faded, but still visible on the 1990 shot. Plus thanks for exact location and address - now added to both images.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 65379774@N02
comment._content: In the last two years the old Court House (Parliament St) had a face lift and a new "lego style" Court House was built behind it.That faded Powers Dining Rooms is still there more faded, not sure its origins.

comment.author: 65379774@N02
comment._content: For years the Kilkenny hurling team on Monday after winning The All Ireland Hurling Final would display the cup "up the steps" of the Court House, this year it will be in the Market Yard or Eyre Square.

comment.author: 37107521@N00
comment._content: companion photo : ! and after 80 years they finally provided a bench for the three (obviously now very aged) people to sit on.

comment.author: 8214568@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/80413507@N08] The very interesting motifs are on the building next door to the Courthouse at 44 Parliament Street (St Francis Abbey Brewery). There is an interesting architectural description of that building here. Although it refers to the “quoins having vermiculated panels” it provides no further explanation.
